title: US Announces $4 Billion Emergency Military Aid Package for Israel
summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio has authorized emergency delivery of $4 billion in military assistance to Israel, reversing previous administration's partial arms embargo. The Trump administration has approved nearly $12 billion in major Foreign Military Sales to Israel since taking office.
content:
Secretary of State Marco Rubio has signed a declaration authorizing emergency delivery of approximately $4 billion in military assistance to Israel. The decision overturns the previous administration's partial arms embargo that had restricted certain weapons and ammunition transfers to Israel.

The move represents a significant shift in policy, with Secretary Rubio noting that "Israel has no greater ally in the White House than President Trump." Since the administration took office, they have approved nearly $12 billion in major Foreign Military Sales (FMS) to Israel.

The announcement coincides with President Trump's repeal of a Biden-era memorandum that had placed what the administration describes as "baseless and politicized conditions" on military assistance to Israel. This change comes at a time when Israel faces what officials characterize as a war of survival against Iran and terror proxies on multiple fronts.

The administration has pledged to continue using all available tools to maintain America's long-standing commitment to Israel's security, including measures to counter security threats.

Press Statement

Marco Rubio, Secretary of State

March 1, 2025

I have signed a declaration to use emergency authorities to expedite the delivery of approximately $4 billion in military assistance to Israel. The decision to reverse the Biden Administration’s partial arms embargo, which wrongly withheld a number of weapons and ammunition from Israel, is yet another sign that Israel has no greater ally in the White House than President Trump.

Since taking office, the Trump Administration has approved nearly $12 billion in major FMS sales to Israel. This important decision coincides with President Trump’s repeal of a Biden-era memorandum which had imposed baseless and politicized conditions on military assistance to Israel at a time when our close ally was fighting a war of survival on multiple fronts against Iran and terror proxies.

The Trump Administration will continue to use all available tools to fulfill America’s long-standing commitment to Israel’s security, including means to counter security threats.
